name: pesticide production, unspecified | pesticide, unspecified | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1835/documentation

This dataset represents the production of  pesticides (1 kg of active ingredient). Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation. Energy consumption is modelled with data from a similar process. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of precursors (acetaldehyde, acetic acid, acetic anhydride, acetone, acetonitrile, acetylene, acrylonitrile, aluminium hydroxide, adipic acid, aluminium, ammonia, ammonium carbonate, ammonium chloride, ammonium thiocyanate, aniline, benzene, benzyl chloride, bromine, butadiene, 2-butanol, butene, butyrolactone, calcium carbide, carbon dioxide, carbon disulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon tetrachloride, chlorine, cumene, dichloromethane, dimethylamine, dimethyl sulfate, ethanol, ethyl acetate, ethylene, ethylene diamine, ethylene dichloride, ethylene oxide, formaldehyde, formic acid, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen, hydrogen cyanide, hydrogen fluoride, hydrogen peroxide, hydrogen sulfide, iodine, isopropanol, liquefied petroleum gas, lithium, maleic anhydride, manganese concentrate, methane, methanol, methyl acetate, methylamine, monochlorobenzene, naphtha, natural gas, nitric acid, nitrobenzene, nitrogen, o-dichlorobenzene, oxygen, p-dichlorobenzene, 1-pentanol, phenol, phosgene, phosphoric acid, phosphorous chloride, phosphorus, phthalic anhydride, potassium hydroxide, propanal, 1-propanol, propylene, propylene glycol, silicon, sodium chloride, sodium cyanide, sodium hydroxide, sodium hypochlorite, sodium methoxide, sodium tetrahydroborate, sulfur, sulfur dioxide, sulfur trioxide, sulfuric acid, toluene, trichloromethane, trimethylamine, urea, water decarbonised, "water, salt, sole", xylene, and zinc) at the factory gate.

This activity ends with pesticides at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions. The dataset doesn't include emulsives, additives etc.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The dataset was calculated from the arithmetic mean of all inputs and outputs of all 78 pesticides.

exchanges.description: Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of heat of 2 MJ for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 12% steam from external energy sources.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.
